title: Think Aloud
summary: Ask people to say what they are doing, what they are thinking while they use the website, this will bring forward any conceptual problem that might be there if not it will be the validation of the website being useful to the audience.
before: You need a working prototype of the website so that someone can use primary features of the website which you want to test.
after: You will get the idea of what is working what is not by the time-taken to finish tasks on the website. From this you can go back to wireframing, prototyping, ideation or even research to fix that problem.

key_steps.text: We need to recruit people like we did during primary research. Ask consent for recording the session while keeping their identity anonymous. We will ask them to perform certain kind of tasks to see how the website we designed performed.
Identify the most important tasks that the user will do on the website. The tasks we will choose need to be fairly complex depending on the complexity of the website.

Ask the users to say aloud what they are seeing on the website and how they are thinking, what are they sure about, what confuses them,  why they clicked any button or did any task, ask them to say it all aloud White everything down sketch if needed.

And by all these data, find which places are generally more confusing than others, which are working well, why is it more or less confusing and so on. From this you have the idea of which areas to fix. Now go back to previous stages and fix accordingly.
